page.title: 15Religion in Hebden Bridge
page.content: The traditional{Christian denominations are well represented. The parish church of{St. James}is about half a mile from the town centre at Mytholm.{Heptonstall}parish church was built during the 19th century like St. James, but the parish itself goes back to medieval times. Hebden Bridge has a new{Methodist}church while Heptonstall has an old octagonal building which has been in continuous use since the days of John Wesley.{St. {Thomas'}Roman Catholic church is on the south side of the town and the priest in charge supervises three other churches in the Calder Valley. The two{Baptist}chapels are located in the town centre. There are other 'fringe' religions pracised by small groups of people but no major world religions.
